div1.p: Sir, I have the honor of to report my arrival in this Colony on the 4th instant.

Having applied to His Excellency Governor O'Connor for leave to act as Commercial Agent, of the United States, without an Evecquation. I have received hid despatch of yesterday date, which I have the honor to enclose, refreshing to recognize me as such, without the Laucleiun of the British Government.
I respectfully suggest that it would perhaps be wll to forward said despatch to London when applicationed is made for an Evequation, which I trust will be done.
To the Honorable Lewis Cap Secretary of State

Now that an Evequation is necessary, endering well thereby one of the object of the appointment of Commercial Agents, why not make this a Consulate under Schedule C: that I may can R with the Consular Representative of France in this place.

This port is certainly more important to American interests than Momoria, Gaboon on St Paul de Loanda; why would not the twice salary be just? the amount offers on about thirty vessels per annuance is quite inadequate to the forces required.
The Case containing Record Books, Flags, we had not yet been received from Monoria, neither has
the seal: Wheatons Elements of, International Law, the Consular Regulations and love blank forms were received in New York.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your most obident + humble servant Daniel R.B. Upton U.S. Commercial Agent
